events.name: Our first coding night ever!
events.description: Hi, for once we're proposing an event in which you'll be coding yourself. Please bring your laptop and you'll be able to choose between the following tracks: - Spring Data JPA - JHipster - Deploying an application on Cloud Foundry Please feel free to contact us if you'd like to propose a different topic. See you on Monday!

events.name: AngularJS w/ASP.NET and Azure User Groups @ 4-May 7:00pm
events.description: AngularJS in an hour by Shawn Wildermuth (United States) Are you still writing your web applications using jQuery and direct DOM manipulation? It’s time to come in the light and embrace Single Page Applications. In this hour-long talk Shawn Wildermuth will walk you through creating a web app using AngularJS from scratch using ASP.NET. About Shawn: Shawn Wildermuth is an thirteen-time Microsoft MVP (ASP.NET/IIS), the author of eight books and dozens of articles on software development, and a Pluralsight author with fifteen courses to his name. He is one of the Wilder Minds ( http://wilderminds.com ) and can be reached at his blog at http://wildermuth.com Azure Session Entertainment, Trading, Private Equity domains on Azure Cloud (Lessons Learnt from a Real World Project) By Sakthis Kumar About Sakthis Kumar: - Globally spanned 15+ yrs of career in Systems Solutions, Infra Architecture, Information Security and Networks - ISPs, Financial Services, ITES, Logistics Business Domains - Certified Novell Administrator / Engineer since 1997 - Microsoft Certified Professional / Systems Engineer since 1999 - Cisco Certified Network Engineer since 2001 - Qualified Information Security Professional since 2011
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Papers We Love SG #009
events.description: Paper #1 - Predicting the NFL Using Twitter (http://arxiv.org/pdf/1310.6998v1.pdf) - Abel Molina Paper #2 - QuickCheck: A Lightweight Tool for Random Testing of Haskell Programs (http://www.eecs.northwestern.edu/~robby/courses/395-495-2009-fall/quick.pdf) - Lucas Bradstreet ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG

events.name: Canonical’s 2015 OpenStack Roadshow - Singapore
events.description:
At this roadshow event, Mark Shuttleworth and the senior architects of Canonical's Openstack strategy will present the product roadmap and exchange views with cloud architects and executive sponsors for private cloud initiatives across the enterprise landscape, globally. The tour has already passed through North and South America, Europe and is now coming to Asia. It is open by invitation to those shaping private cloud strategy in select companies. 
  
Join us if Openstack is a real goal in your next 12 months. Topics will include: 

Software-defined network (SDN) evaluation strategies
Use of OpenStack for Network Function Virtualisation and other telco use cases
Security considerations for banking and other regulated industries
Scale-out storage options like Ceph and Lustre
Integration with existing infrastructure such as SANs and VMware
The intersection of industrial HPC and Openstack
Hyperdense hosting with KVM virtual machines and LXD system containers

 
  
Schedule: 10.00am: Coffee and registration  
10.30am: Presentations commence 
12.30am: Presentations end 
 Sign up to the Singapore event here or check out the full list of roadshow locations.
events.location: Marina Bay Sands Singapore, , 10 Bayfront Ave, Singapore 018956

events.name: AWS First Tuesday - May Meet up
events.description: After a successful SG User Group meetup in April, I'm pleased to announce that we will be holding an 'AWS - First Tuesday' User Group meetup on 5th May 2015 here in the AWS Singapore office. Expect a similar format, new speakers, new features - and with more Pizza this time! We'll also start a little earlier with Pizza from 7pm. WHAT: 7.00 pm - Pizza and refreshments 7.30 pm - Chris Hampartsoumian, AWS Welcome, new features since the last meet up (there's been lots!) + taking a look at Amazon Machine Learning. 7.50 pm - CTO of RedMart.com, Rajesh Lingappa has agreed to come and tell us about their story. A must see. (+ 5 mins Q&A) 8.10pm - CTO of PocketMath, Andrew Alcock will be talking about their business and some of the technology that they use to run their platform. (+5 mins Q&A) 8.30pm - Chris Hampartsoumian - closing remarks & upcoming events. We're looking forward to seeing you at the meetup! As an AWS User, if you'd like to register for the free IoT Hack Day on May 18th, registration is at: http://aws.amazon.com/summits/singapore/hackday/ WHERE: The AWS Singapore office. https://goo.gl/maps/UzzR2 WHO CAN ATTEND: All are welcome! No prior experience needed. • Anyone who wants to know more about cloud computing and startup companies • Anyone who wants to understand the benefits of cloud computing and how to use the “cloud” to benefit their organization. • Startup founders and aspiring founders COST: Free! Snacks will be served!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300

events.description: Let's meetup again and have a bit of fun coding the assignments together. Please try and watch the week's lectures beforehand. It's also a good idea if you download the dependencies beforehand too. (Though Lowercase cafe has good WiFi, so if you need to, you can setup your environment once you get here.) https://class.coursera.org/reactive-002

events.name: Meteor April (in May) Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, We are group of people who think MeteorJS is awesome. We are planning our April (in May) meetup of the Meteor JS group. Call for speakers! Message us or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Deploying Meteor Apps to Production Environments - Tze Ken Lee #2 - Adding a RESTful interface to your Meteor App - Rick Behl #3 - TBC #4 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg/ Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #5 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Pizza and drinks will be provided courtesy of AWS. Location: AWS Offices Singapore 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Organizers : Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10, 23 Church Street, Singapore

events.name: Yet Another Two Haskell Talks in May (by Arnauld and Gergo)
events.description: A big thanks to Michał's support so that we could use HackerSpace.SG as a steady base for the meetup. Starting from May, we would try to change to a monthly schedule, We try to arrange the meetup to be at the first Wednesday of each month, since we observe that more RSVP on meetup hosted on Wednesday. Therefore we always welcome speakers willing to share things related to Haskell, no matter it is basic or advanced or lightning talk. Don't hesitate to contact us. For the meetup in May, we would have three haskell talks. First one is Arnaud Bailly share on building startup in haskell. Second one is FPGA synthesis by Dr. Gergő Érdi. We are going to finish with a lightning talk on an alternative description of Haskell packages by Simon Hengel. * Haskell all the way down - building a startup in Haskell Sneak peak of past slide: https://speakerdeck.com/abailly/haskell-all-the-way-down * FPGA synthesis with Kansas Lava * hpack: An alternative format for Haskell packages (lightning talk) # Speakers: Arnaud Bailly: https://github.com/abailly Dr. Gergő Érdi: http://unsafePerform.IO Simon Hengel: http://typeful.net
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: Product Strategy and Product Success with Roman Pichler - Product Camp Singapore
events.description:
Roman Pichler is a leading agile product management and Scrum expert, and the founder of Pichler Consulting. He has more than 10 years experience in  training and coaching product managers and product owners, and a long track record in helping companies apply agile practices to achieve business success.  
Roman is the author of “Agile Product Management with Scrum”. He has created several powerful agile product management and UX tools, and he writes a popular blog on product ownership. 
He is going to deliver a talk on Product Strategy and Product Success. 
  
  
P.S. : Since we have limited seats, please be mindful not to cancel once you register.
events.location: Fusionopolis, , Autodesk Asia Pte Ltd, 3 Fusionopolis Way, #10-21 Symbiosis, 138633, Singapore 138633

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm PV868 By TeZ 8pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 Set your mind free through PV868, an experimental audio-visual performance created by 2015 Art/Science Resident artist, TeZ. Experience the hypnotic effects of moving visual patterns, emerging directly from the interaction of the brainwaves with the sound and light stimulation, unique to each individual. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis. DISCLAIMER: PV868 performance is based on the use of flickering video light which might cause seizures in people suffering of photogenic or photosensitive epilepsy. You should not attend this show if you are already aware of being epileptic and, in any case, the artist cannot be considered responsible of the effects produced by the audio-visual stimulus of this performance. In no case will #TeZ (aka Maurizio Martinucci) or the organizers of this event be liable for chance, accidental, special, direct or indirect damages or undesired effects resulting from partaking the experience of this show.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Nurturing Leonardos
events.description: Nurturing Leonardos: An international conference Dates: Thursday 7 May, Friday 8 May, Saturday 9 May 2015 Venue: ArtScience Museum, 6 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore bit.ly/nurturingleonardos Free event. Register on the day. On 8 and 9 May 2015, ArtScience Museum will host a conference exploring the legacy of history's most celebrated artist and scientist, Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519). This conference will explore da Vinci's way of thinking and the cultural landscape which nurtured him. It will analyse how his interdisciplinary approach, which we now refer to as “systems thinking” and "complexity", remains resonant for us today, and if and how it can be applied within the fields of art, science, technology, education and futures thinking. The conference has been co-convened by Honor Harger and Anna Salaman (ArtScience Museum), and Andrea Nanetti (Nanyang Technological University, School of Art, Design and Media). Thursday 7 May 2015, 7pm – 10pm ArtScience Late will feature a special performance from, our international ArtScience resident, Maurizio Martinucci (TeZ). The show is free, and there will be performances at 8pm and 9pm. For more, see: https://www.facebook.com/events/628941177236899/ Friday 8 May 2015, 10am – 6pm The first full day of the conference presents Leonardo da Vinci and the approach that he took to all of his lines of enquiries. It analyses how da Vinci not only understood the essence of ‘systems thinking’, but how he also applied this to his inventions, ideas and work generally. We will explore if there was something within the context of da Vinci’s time which encouraged his thinking and ‘systems’ awareness, or if his approach was a one-off. We will ask if there are there other examples of interdisciplinary thinking and approaches throughout history. The day will continue with a reflection on the more recent times and the advent of new media – a marriage of two seemingly quite separate, established disciplines: art and technology, moving the dialogue into the 20th century, and beyond. Timetable and Speakers for Friday 8 May 10:00am Registration 10.15am Welcome remarks by Conference Chairs Honor Harger and Andrea Nanetti 10:30am Session 1: Keynote on Leonardo da Vinci’s approach to systems thinking Chair: Don Alberto Rocca, Director of Pinacoteca Ambrosiana, Milan, Italy Speaker Professor Paolo Galluzzi Director, Institute and Museum of History of Science, Florence (Italy), Chair of the Advisory Boards of the National Edition of Leonardo da Vinci’s Manuscripts and Drawings and of the Updates to the National Edition of Galileo Galilei’s Work 11:15am Conversation and Q&A between Don Rocca and Professor Galluzzi 11.30am Don Alberto Rocca, Director of Pinacoteca Ambrosiana, Milan, Italy, speaking on the educational and cultural context in the time of Leonardo. 12pm Lunch break 1pm Session 2: Historical applications of systems thinking Chair: David Harvey, Senior Vice-President of Exhibitions, American Museum of Natural History and chair of the International Advisory Board Member for ArtScience Museum Speakers: Gunalan Nadarajan, Independent Art Theorist and Curator and International Advisory Board Member for ArtScience Museum – speaking along the lines of his paper Automation and Robotics in Muslim Heritage: The Cultural Roots of al-Jazari's Mechanical Systems Gregory Clancey, Associate Professor, Department of History, National University of Singapore, who will critically address the idea of systems, and its relation to Leonardo, from the viewpoint of an historian of technology. Margaret Tan, Fellow and Director of Programmes, Tembusu College, National University of Singapore, who will be contemplating if Singapore has the cultural landscape to nurture “Leonardos” of tomorrow. 2.30pm Tea break 3pm Session 3: Systems thinking in art Chair: Vibeke Sorensen, Chair, NTU School of Art, Design and Media, Singapore Speakers: Luciano Chessa, Composer, performer, musicologist - speaking to his paper, ‘L’Arte dei ‘Romori’: Leonardine Devotion in Luigi Russolo’s Oeuvre Ruben de la Nuez, Lecturer at School of Art, Design and Media, NTU – speaking on New Media Art: Leonardo da Vinci and the Equation of Art and Technology Isabelle Desjeux, Artist and scientist, based in Singapore, with a scientific background background in molecular biology. 5pm Closing remarks by Honor Harger and Andrea Nanetti 5.15pm Optional Tour of Da Vinci: Shaping the Future 6.15pm End of proceedings Saturday 9 May 2015 The whistle-stop tour through key ‘systems thinkers’ in history from the previous day continues with a day exploring contemporary ‘systems approaches’, specifically addressing the areas. It will cover how science and technology environments might nurture the "Leonardos" of tomorrow and stimulate interdisciplinary working, and look at innovative education and pedagogical methodologies today which will encourage the same. Fittingly, the last session looks to the future. Curated by Forum for the Future, it addresses how complex problems of this time may be solved using multidisciplinary and the ‘systems’, or ‘complexity theory’ approaches. A sub-theme will explore addressing challenges at scale. 10:00am Registration 10.30am Session 4: Systems thinking in science and technology Chair: Honor Harger, Executive Director, ArtScience Museum. Speakers: Eileen Tan, Science Centre Singapore, and Maker Faire Singapore Peng Kian Tan, Centre for Quantum Technologies, NUS, Singapore Veerappan Swaminathan, One Maker Group and the Sustainable Living Lab, Singapore Grace Sai, CEO and Co-Founder, The Hub, Singapore 12:30pm Lunch break and optional tour of Da Vinci: Shaping the Future 1.30pm Session 5: Systems thinking in Education Chair: Kenneth Kwok, Director (Arts & Youth and Strategic Planning), National Arts Council Speakers: Venka Purushothaman, Academic, arts and cultural manager, and writer and Vice President and Provost of LASALLE College of the Arts, Singapore Noorlinah Mohamed, Arts Consultant, Singapore Tong Yee, founder of The Thought Collective and the School of Thought, Singapore 3.30pm Tea break 4pm Session 6: Systems thinking in Foresight and Futures Chair: Cheryl Chung, Strategic Foresight Practitioner Speakers: Alistair Douglas, Managing Director of SmartAqua, Asia Yin Shanyang: Swarm design studio, Singapore Zhen Goh, Senior Consultant at Cognitive Edge, Singapore Justin Pickard, Anthropologist of technology and innovation, UK 6pm Closing remarks by Honor Harger and Andrea Nanetti 6.30pm End of proceedings
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Rapid system design with LabVIEW
events.description: LabVIEW software is ideal for any measurement or control system. Integrating all the tools that engineers and scientists need to build a wide range of applications in dramatically less time, LabVIEW is a development environment for problem solving, accelerated productivity, and continual innovation. In this workshop, you will • learn about LabVIEW, and see how it is easily integrated with hardware to build a measurement system • observe demonstrations on circuit design • build your own audio equalizer

events.name: Null Singapore Humla - Write your own burp suite plugins
events.description:
Note: This is a free but an invite only event. If you are selected you will receive venue and other information via e-mail. (Laptop is mandatory for participation) 
 
What is null Humla ?  
Null Humla is a hands on workshop where attendees get to get their hands dirty with red team tools and usually held for 3-4 hours. The humla champion will be helping you in understanding and applying the content to real world scenarios.  
  
Humla Champion: Mohammed A Imran 
About Humla Champion - Mohammed A Imran aka secfigo is senior software security engineer at Autodesk and specializes in vulnerability assessment, penetration testing and static code analysis(SAST). He loves to build infosec communities, share his knowledge with the community  and has organized around 60+ secuirty events for the best null chapter, null hyderabad in India. He now leads null Singapore chapter. 
When not at work, he likes to practise his design skills and fiddle with development frameworks. 
  
Details of the workshop: 
1) Introduction to Burp Extender API 
2) Problems with Jython coercion 
3) Hello world Burp plugin 
4) Build, modify and send HTTP requests and retrieve responses 
5) Hows ProxyListener, HTTPListener different   
6) Automate manual efforts while doing assessments 
           - e.g., Automate the process of modifying the signed requests 
7) Work on any specific scenarios which you want to automate.  
   
Prerequisites: 
Knowledge: Fundamentals of OOPS concepts, basic python skills and some experience with burp suite. 
Hardware: Any dual core machine with 4 GB RAM, minimum 20 GB free space. 
Software: Windows 7 x64/ Any Linux Variant , Java 64 bit, Python 2.7 and Jython Standalone, Burp suite professional or Free version. 
Editor : Notepad++ (preferred) or any editor of your choice ( VIM or emacs anyone ;) )  
  
Useful Links: 
We will use windows as our development platform but any platform should do.  
  
Burp suite - http://portswigger.net/burp/download.htmlJython - 
Jython standalone 2.7rc2 version  - http://www.jython.org/downloads.html  
Python 2.7 - https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-279/  
Vmware Player for running Samurai or WTE images - https://my.vmware.com/web/vmware/free#desktop_end_user_computing/vmware_player/7_0  
  
Please reach out to me at morpheus@null.co.in or @secfigo if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.location: TBD, , selected individuals will be informed of thevenue, Singapore null

At the Data & Tech Workshop on 12 May, you can learn about the role data and new technologies are playing towards building Health 2.0. It's going to be an exciting week, so don't miss the Future of Health event and the Services Workshop we're organising. Then, top the week off with the Smart Health Hack, where you get to work alongside experts and passionate citizens. Each workshop will have a team formation session, where you can meet other like-minded participants and start forming your teams for the Smart Health Hack!    
PROGRAMME

events.name: Data Mining with R (Workshop I)
events.description: Hello everyone, At RUGS, we would like to encourage more people to use R, and to use R to do good statistics. As such, Alex and I are organising a series of tutorials on the top data mining algorithms. The content of the talks will aim to cover a little understanding of the theory, but will mostly focus on examples with R. The 8 - 10 algorithms we aim to cover include: • k-means • SVM • Apriori • Naive Bayes • Random forests and decision/regression trees • EM • kNN • AdaBoost We intend for the sessions to be held on a monthly basis, lasting about an hour or so. The venue will be 237 South Bridge Road. We’ll have to collect SGD 5 a head, but this goes toward the venue and refreshments (not into our pockets =)). We'll collect it at the door on the day itself. The speakers for the talks will be our very own RUGS members. If you are an expert in one of the topics and would like to conduct the session, do let us know! For the first talk, Alex will be speaking about SVM. Here is a short overview of the talk, and a little bit about Alex too About SVM: SVM is nowadays one of the most popular classification algorithms. It is efficient in dealing big data set. It allows us to fit nonlinear classification boundary with kernel methods. Moreover, the combination of penalization and “customized” kernel enable us to introduce prior knowledge into classification. In this R share session, we will quickly go through the theoretical part of SVM, and demonstrate the application with R package “kernlab”. And last but not least, we will show 2 examples to let you feel the power of SVM. About Alex: I am a statistician in HSOR@NHG. I have been studying statistics for 6 years and using R for 6 years. My research areas are statistical learning, computing statistics, data visualization and data science with population health management.
events.location: 237 (http://237.io/), 237 South Bridge Road Singapore 058786

events.name: 5th Tableau User Group Singapore Meetup
events.description: Hi Everyone, Based on feedback from the previous meeting, we will be having the next meetup in the evening. We will be starting around 7pm on the 14th of May. Co-working space "The Working Capitol" has generously sponsored one of the workshop rooms for us to organize the 5th Tableau User Group Singapore Meetup The agenda will be as follows. 19:00 Refreshments and Networking 19:25 Welcome and introduction (5 min) 19:30 1st Topic (20min) 19:50 Tableau Announcements / Topics (10min) 20:00 2nd Topic (20min) - Re-viz-it 20:20 3rd Topic (20min) 20:40 Interesting Links, Blogs and Articles (5 min) 20:45 Q&A and Collective Problem Solving (15 min) 21:00 Closing Bring your laptop with Tableau installed, if you have problems, you could show and ask the group, or one-on-one. If you are interested to show your awesome Tableau Visualization, or want to share a really cool trick you found, let us know we can either slot you in for a 10-15 min demo, or we could do it during the Q&A and Collective Problem Solving. One last request : We would like to get to know you a little better. Help us by filling in a quick survey to tell about yourself, and what you would like to see from the Tableau User Group. Singapore Tableau User Group Survey Thanks Richard, Zane and Jimmy TUGS Organizers

It's going to be an exciting week, so don't miss the Future of Health event and the Data & Tech Workshop that we're also organising. events.name: Hack Day - Smart Health coLAB
events.description:
The Smart Health Hack Day on Saturday, 16 May, will be a playground for developers, start-up teams, data scientists, and anyone interested in Smart Health to experiment with data, technologies, APIs, devices, and more to create their own prototypes - solutions that might address the challenge of Health 2.0.    
Come meet passionate people working in digital health, technology gurus and expert developers. Share your experience with the less experienced. Form new connections with like-minded innovators.    
If you're already doing smart things with health applications, please email us. We welcome you to come and do a show-and-tell.    
Don't miss the Future of Health event, and the Data & Tech, and Services Workshops we're also organising as part of the Smart Health coLAB. They're an excellent opportunity to inspire ideas and start forming your teams ahead of the Hack Day.    
PROGRAMME 
Find out more about what's in store for you here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, , 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: May Meetup
events.location: Hood Bar and Cafe @ Bugis+ (formerly Iluma), Bugis+, 201 Victoria Street, #05-07, Singapore 188067

events.name: May 2015 Data Science Meetup
events.description: Two talks for this particular meetup: 1. IBM: James Pang Topic: Key Technologies behind Business Analytics Bio: Dr. Pang is a Visiting Assistant Professor at the School of Computing, National University of Singapore. He is also a Senior Managing Consultant in IBM with specialty in Analytics and Optimization. Dr. Pang has broad experience inside IBM. Prior to the current role, he was the Client Technical Advisor (Chief Architect, Analytics and Optimization) at IBM Government and Healthcare Center of Competency, and led the IBM technical solution design in ASEAN Public Sector. Before that, he was a Senior Manager at IBM R&D Labs in charge of analytics and optimization product development. Before joining IBM, Dr. Pang was a Research Scientist at Motorola Labs and focused on development and implementation of Operations Research models and methods to solve problems in supply chains and manufacturing systems.Dr. Pang completed his PhD research in Operations Research and System Engineering areas at National University of Singapore (NUS) and Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). He completed his Master and Bachelor studies in Engineering at Zhejiang University, China. 2. A*STAR: Alex Chia Synopsis of talk: With the rapid growth in the usage of social networks worldwide, uploading and sharing of user-generated content has become increasingly prevalent. In particular, users are increasingly sharing visual content, often accompanied with limited amount of text. We believe, as social media moves in a more visual direction, monitoring & advertising technologies needs to be more visual. In this talk, we present our technologies which leverage on this new source of data to monitor and track events as well as to profile social media users. Bio: Alex Chia is the Head of Social Media and Internet Vision Analytics Lab and concurrently the Assistant Director of Visual Intelligence Analytics Center of the Institute for Infocomm Research. Dr. Chia was awarded the Tan Sri Dr. Tan Chin Tuan Scholarship in 2004 and the A*STAR Graduate Scholarship in 2006. He was awarded the Tan Kah Kee Young Inventors’ Merit Award and Silver Award in 2009 and 2012 respectively. His research interests include computer vision, image processing and machine learning.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Git Meetup 0.2.0
events.description: It's time for the second meetup! This meetup is aimed at both beginners and people who have over 10 years of Git experience (wait a minute…). We hope to stretch your Gitability level, and better your understanding of version control systems! Programme: • "Debugging with Git": Ryan Dao • Git is more than just a version control system. It's also one of the best debugging tools if used correctly. In this talk I'm going to show how Git and Delta Debugging can be used to help identity issues in your codebase. • "Interactive rebasing with Git": Jason Chionh • In this short talk, we'll go through the command "git rebase -i". This is git rebasing in interactive mode. You can use it to organize local commit history. Specifically, we'll look at squashing many commits into one commit and re-ordering commits. • Lightning talk: Stashing, yo! Angelo Rohit • One more lightning talk, anyone? Come merge with your fellow Gits! Interested in speaking? Please leave a message in this group! (We're looking for lightning talks!) Venue and food sponsor: Autodesk (thanks guys!)
events.location: Autodesk Asia Pte Ltd, 1 Fusionopolis Walk, #04-11 Solaris North Tower, Singapore

events.name: May Meetup with Jon Matonis
events.description: Hi Everyone, Jon Matonis, founding director of Bitcoin Foundation will be in Singapore in May. Join this meetup to meet him in person. Meetup will be hosted by The Co-Foundry, new accelerator focusing on FinTech startups in cooperation with Sillicon Valley-based Plug&Play Tech Center. Soft drinks and beer will be available for Bitcoin and fiat. See you! Tomas
events.location: The Co-Foundry, Unit 11 Lor 24A Geylang Singapore 398535

events.name: Workshop for Youth
events.description: Since Maker Faire will be a larger scale event this year, we would need the support of Youth! We would like to welcome you to our free workshop on 23rd May 2015 at Science Centre from 2pm to 5pm. This workshop is conducted for you to understand what Maker Faire is all about and if you are interested you can contribute to Maker Faire as Makers or volunteers.
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. 24 May 2015, Sunday, 1pm – 7pm ArtScience Galleries, Level 4 FREE Amplified! The Best of the School of Art, Design and Media Nanyang Technological University Final Year students from the School of Art, Design and Media present a vibrant selection of creative works across and between disciplines, media and technology, including graphic and product design, interactive installations and animation.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Ethereum Visits Singapore
events.description: Join us for this Two-day event to learn more about block chain 2.0 technology and how it applies to the real world. We will provide an introduction to block chain technology and it's use cases apart from bitcoin. The second day of the event will be a coding workshop for everyone of all skill levels to participate and see what kind of interesting programs they can come up with on the block chain. George Hallem and Ken Kappler will be speaking on behalf of Ethereum, and we will have live video conferences with a few start ups on the block chain, ie www.provenance.org, DigixGlobal (www.dgx.io), the first smart asset company built on Ethereum's block chain, will also be helping to host the event. Calvin Soh will also be guest speaking. He was a creative director for several mnc ad agencies and is currently a branding and marketing consultant for innovative technologies. Amazing dinner will be served so come with empty stomachs and open minds! Spaces are limited so please sign up for this free and informative event!
events.location: Singapore Management University Administration Building Level 4, 81 Victoria Street

events.name: Virtual Reality Theraphy- VR/AR meetup#4
events.description: We invited Institude of Mental Health to present the VR system they have developed for the children with selective mutism. Agenda: 1. Get to know everyone 2. Topics VR Therapy for selective mutism children - Instituted of Mental health VR app review - Jia Hen • InMind VR 3d Scanner review - Sydney Wu 3. AR/VR project pitch. 4. Getting feedback!
events.location: #03-04, IDA labs @ National Design Centre,  #03-04, 111 Middle Road, 188969, Singapore
events.group_name: SGVRAR - SG Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality meetup

events.name: Ethereum Pub Crawl / Social event
events.description: On Saturday, join us get to meet the community who are interested in blockchain technology and knock back a few drinks together. Ethereum's devs will be gracing this event. This will be an informal gathering of blockchain and tech enthusiasts to network, hangout, ask questions and of course have fun. Looking forward to seeing as many people there! No age limit (just be above 18)! Location TBD, or if anyone has a good spot to recommend please pm me. See you there!
events.location: Level 33, 8 Marina Blvd 33-01 Marina Bay Financial Tower, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm Chicks on Speed: The Art of Work Part 2 In collaboration with Malvina Tan, Dinu Bodiciu and Lennat Mak 8.30pm Expressions Gallery, Level 4 Globetrotting performance, art, music, and new media collective Chicks on Speed take the stage this ArtScience Late with their special mix of irony and electronic beats. Merging video, choreography and fashion, they will be playing live against the backdrop of their surrealistic and poetic short films. Be prepared for an evening that will be visually stunning as well as sonically explosive. In partnership with NTU CCA Residencies Programme.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: We will be holding a HEBOCON challenge as part of the South East Asia Makerspace Summit scheduled to be held from 5-7 June 2015. Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. This event will serve as a testbed for the organizers to improve the competition processes leading to the HEBOCON main event in July. Thank you. For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG

events.name: Making With Light
events.description: Its the International Year of Light! Light plays a vital role in our daily lives and is an imperative cross-cutting discipline of science in the 21st century. It has revolutionized medicine and opened up international communication. Come join us and tinker with Light
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Lean Beer
events.description: Grab a beer, be merry and have a Lean Coffee style discussion. We will be focusing on the topics that are of interest to you. Anything from Kanban (duh), Scrum, Lean, Lean UX, Lean Startup, Agile practices to issues that you are addressing with the team today. Topic generation will be from 6:30 - 6:45pm. Discussion from 6:45pm onwards Beginners to experts are all welcome!
events.location: Penny Black, 27 Boat Quay, Singapore
